revised_title: Relative Transmission of Papain Hydrolyzed Homologous y-Globulin Fractions in Rabbit Foetal Circulation
tldr: The study investigates the transmission of three fractions of papain-digested rabbit y-globulin, trace-labeled with 131I, from the uterine cavity to the foetal circulation in rabbits. The results show that the three fractions are transmitted at different rates, with fraction III being transmitted nearly as readily as whole y-globulin. This suggests that fraction III, which contains most of the antigenic groups of the original molecule, may have the configuration recognized by the cells as homologous y-globulin.
